DataElement.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Identifier PCORnet CDM Procedure Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing._Arbitrary identifier for each unique record.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.
